title-group.article-title: THE FERMAT-TYPE EQUATIONS x⁵ + y⁵ = 2z p OR 3z p SOLVED THROUGH ℚ-CURVES

abstract.p: We solve the Diophantine equations x⁵ + y⁵ = dzp with d = 2, 3 for a set of prime numbers of density 3/4. The method consists of relating a possible solution to another Diophantine equation and solving the latter via a generalized modular technique. Indeed, we will apply a multi-Frey technique with two ℚ-curves along with a new technique for eliminating newforms.
